verses.text: 智慧不是在呼喚，聰明不是在發聲嗎？

words.note: Often personified in Proverbs.
Parallels wisdom, often denotes spiritual discernment.

verses.text: 它在路旁高處的最高點，在十字路口站著；
在城門旁，在城門口，在進城門的空地上大聲呼喊：

words.note: Describes the location for those entering the city.
Used as a locative suffix here.

verses.text: 「眾人哪！我向你們呼喚，對世人發聲。

words.note: Common term of address in scripture.
Refers to humanity at large, often in a moral context.

verses.text: 愚蒙人哪！你們要學習精明；愚昧人哪！你們心裡要明白事理。

words.note: Refers to those easily misled or lacking experience, a theme in Proverbs.
Refers to practical wisdom and discerning judgment.
Refers to those who lack or reject wisdom, a key theme in Proverbs.
Refers to moral or logical principles.

verses.text: 你們聽著，因為我要講論極美的事，我要開口說正直的事；

words.note: Here, 著 indicates an imperative or an ongoing action.
Verb-object compound, 'open one's mouth'.

verses.text: 我的口要論述真理，我的嘴唇厭惡邪惡。
我口裡的一切話都是公義的，毫無彎曲欺詐。

words.note: Implies 'my words'.

verses.text: 我的話對明理的人，都是對的；對得著知識的人，都是正直的。
你們要接受我的教訓，不要銀子；寧願得著知識，勝過精金；
因為智慧比紅寶石更好，你一切所喜愛的都不能和智慧比較。

words.note: A key concept in Proverbs, often personified.
Forms a nominal phrase indicating the object of the following verb.
A key concept in Proverbs, often personified.

verses.text: 我──智慧──和精明同住，我又獲得知識和謀略。

words.note: Here, 'wisdom' refers to herself in the first person.
Often implies strategic thinking or counsel.

verses.text: 敬畏耶和華就是恨惡邪惡；驕傲、狂妄、邪惡的行為、乖謬的口，我都恨惡。

words.note: The 'fear of the Lord' is a foundational concept in wisdom literature.
The Hebrew name for God, often rendered 'LORD' in English Bibles.

verses.text: 我有才智和大智慧，我有聰明，我有能力。
君王藉我掌權，統治者藉我制定法紀。
領袖、貴族和所有公義的審判官，都藉我治國。

words.note: Lit. 'leading outstanding person'.
A key biblical concept.

verses.text: 愛我的，我必愛他；殷切尋找我的，必定尋見。

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun: 'those who love me'.
Often used in formal or literary contexts.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun: 'those who earnestly seek me'.
Lit. 'seek and see/find'.

verses.text: 財富和尊榮是我的，恆久的財產和公義也是我的。

words.note: Indicates possession or belonging.

verses.text: 我的果實勝過黃金，勝過精金，我的出產勝過純銀。
我走在公義的道上，行在公正的路上，

words.note: Can also mean 'truth, principle', similar to 'Tao'.
Used as a locative suffix indicating 'on the...'.
More formal or literary than '走' (zǒu).
Used as a locative suffix indicating 'on the...'.

verses.text: 使愛我的承受財產，使他們的府庫滿溢。

words.note: Often used in historical/biblical contexts for official treasuries.

verses.text: 在耶和華創造的開始，在太初創造一切以先，就有了我。

words.note: Refers to the primordial beginning, often used in creation accounts.

verses.text: 在亙古、在太初，在未有大地之前，我已經被立；

words.note: Used in poetic or religious contexts to mean 'from eternity past'.
Refers to the primordial beginning, often used in creation accounts.

verses.text: 沒有深淵，沒有大水的泉源以先，我已經出生。

words.note: Refers to the deep, primeval waters or the underworld.
Often refers to primordial waters or floods in biblical context.

verses.text: 大山未曾奠定，小山未有以先，我已經出生。
那時，耶和華還沒有造大地和田野，也沒有造地上的泥土。
他立定諸天的時候，我在那裡；他在淵面上界劃地平線的時候，我在那裡；

words.note: Refers to all celestial bodies or realms.
Refers to the primordial deep or abyss.

verses.text: 他上使穹蒼堅固，下使深淵的水泉穩定；

words.note: Modifies the following verb '使'.
Refers to the firmament or expanse of the sky.
Modifies the following verb '使'.
Refers to the great deep or subterranean waters.

verses.text: 他為海洋定出界限，海水不能越過他的命令，他又劃定大地的根基；
那時，我在他身邊作工匠，每天都充滿喜樂，時常在他面前歡笑，

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to describe spiritual joy.

verses.text: 在他的大地上歡笑，和世人一同喜樂。

words.note: Often refers to the inhabited earth in biblical context.
Used as a locative particle after a noun.

verses.text: 孩子們，現在你們要聽從我；持守我道路的，是有福的。

words.note: `們` is a plural suffix for people.
Forms a phrase referring to 'those who...'

verses.text: 你們要聽從教訓，要作智慧人，不可離棄教訓。
聽從我，天天在我門口警醒仰望，在我門框旁邊守候的人，是有福的。

words.note: Forms a phrase referring to 'the one who...'

verses.text: 因為找到我的，就找到生命，他也必得著耶和華的恩惠。

words.note: Forms a phrase referring to 'the one who...'
Often refers to spiritual or eternal life in biblical context.

verses.text: 得罪我的，是傷害自己；凡是恨惡我的，就是喜愛死亡。」

words.note: Verb-object compound, lit. 'obtain sin'
Forms a nominal phrase: 'the one who offends me'
A formal way to say 'anyone who' or 'all who'
Stronger than '恨' alone, often used in moral contexts.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'the one who hates me'
Indicates a consequence or conclusion.
